dialogues.text: Hydraulically, the chair rises into position.  Ophelia st at the mirrored ceiling, breathing in the gas, as Dr. Man moves between her spread legs. Ophelia sees Shelley standing over her; angel-blue eyes staring down, a smile half-hidden beneath the surgical ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Ophelia.  Everything will be fine.  It's just like magic.  You go to sleep and when you wake up, you'll feel wonderful.  Your legs will be smooth and beautiful.  It's what you want, isn't it?  To be beautiful. Ophelia's body becomes light, transubstantiating with the and she feels herself floating up towards her reflection. Through the slurred syrup of her senses, she hears the wh of the machine. The first tiny white bits of Ophelia's inner thigh slap against the glass wall of the catch as the splattering so becomes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coughing hiss of whipped cream spitting out the nozzl into a cloud-like mound. Ophelia puts a spoon into the chocolate sundae and carrie to the living room. John is on the futon.  He looks like a piece of overcooke meat; his eyes are dark and hollow, his face grey and gau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're okay?  You don't look very good, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.  I'm just tired.  Tired and hungry. She hands him the sundae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope this helps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not having one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My surprise. John scoops up a spoonful of ice cream into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh yes.  The surprise.  When do I see the surprise? Her smile says something naughty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did what? Slowly, she slides her loose fitting dress up over her thighs, revealing the heavy white binders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god.  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some lipo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  The cellulite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia, you're crazy.  Your body is perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As perfect as Mimi's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Mimi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one you were drooling over when you came to take me to lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't drooling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You certainly were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a little.  But I wasn't really interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  There was nothing to her.  I could tell.  She's like an appetizer, pretty, but never very satisfying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything about food with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food is life, you know. He grabs hold of her, lifting her into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you to your bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you wanted dessert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is later.  They are both asleep, fit tight to each oth like spoons.  Again, John is having a tortured night. His face is wet with sweat when his body seems to jerk hi awake. There is a smell in the air that swirls about him like a perfume.  He turns and sees the bandages on Ophelia's thi His gut squeezes hard and demanding as a fist.  Sick and afraid, he pushes himself off the bed, away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... John?  What are you doing? Hurriedly, he gets dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.  I'm not feeling very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it.  Something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you'll go see a doctor.  I'll give you the money.  Just promise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I will.  I promise.  Now, go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me. He does, but as her eyes close and he pulls away, he noti something he never had before -- The taste of her lips. Quickly, he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John crosses the street towards "Babe The Blue Ox's BBQ," late night take-out joint. There is a group of rowdies in leather, sitting outside despite the cold, guzzling beer and gobbling barbecued chicken. Smoke is billowing from the stack and John catches the sc of char-broiling ribs.  He grimaces. A woman in the group, nibbling at a chicken wing begins t laugh, a high drunken cackle. Something is wrong.  John looks at her and sees that she now holding a large, fleshy piece of raw meat. The human like skin flaps with her laughter and a piece o gelatin falls to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you looking at? John turns, glimpsing that the woman is again holding a chicken wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickhead. John hurries away, clutching his stomach.  Very faintly, ambulance siren can be heard. Something catches his eye and he stops beneath a sign tha reads: "Casmir's Butcher Shoppe."  The siren is getting louder. His head cocked, staring into the window listening to a s that is growing in his head; a sound like the buzzing of flies. The ambulance booms past, splashing red light across John the store front window.  In that moment John sees hanging the window, massive slabs of rancid meat covered with mag and flies.  Dotted with black ink spots of rot, they swin ever so slightly, dripping oil and gelatin to the ground. John spins away, doubling over as he vomits.  We see the window now filled with a beautiful assortment of meats an sausages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stumbles toward the open alley door when he catches scent that immediately bolsters his strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mundi is at the stove, stirring the burbling stew which i an unusually large pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Granny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off to bed.  She's left me to tend the stew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, it smells good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hungry.  I can smell it on your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been feeling very well.  My stomach... is upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps just a taste then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe.  Just a little. Mundi steps away and John edges closer to the stove.  The rising vapors envelop him with medicinal magic. Mundi smiles as John slurps the thick broth from the spoo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, that's good. He dips the spoon in for another when a hand shoots up ou the stew and grabs his wrist. Screaming, he wrestles to get free as the stew-demon rise out of the brown magma until we see his face and realize It is John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wakes, terrified.  Gradually, the panic subsides and, it does, thoughts begin to fill his mind with the chill o ice water. Determined, he rises from his bed and heads for where he knows he must go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long blade knife is pushed through the wall and John methodically jimmies back the bolt from the jamb.  The do swings open without a sound. The stairs curl like a beckoning finger into the darkness below. John descends, sweating almost immediately, clutching his knife.  From below, we begin to hear music, barely audibl crackling through the old, cheap radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is a catchy little Muzak number like "The Girl Ipanema." Through a slit, John sees Otto in the workshop.  The butcher's hands are bloody to the elbows as he carries something that looks like a bleeding basketball. John moves with him, catching glimpses as Otto waddles to nearest refrigerator, a bulbous 1950's model which he ope Standing in the wash of white refrigerator light and a swirling mist of cold steam, Otto checks the object and t sets it inside.  He then closes the door and goes back to work. Silently, John makes his way towards the refrigerator. In the background, over the continuing Muzak we hear Otto he returns to work.  The sounds are grisly, leading the imagination towards the most gruesome speculations; the b and forth grate of a saw, followed by a series of shreddi sounds like corn being husked and then a snapping like th cracking of crab legs. John inches towards the door handle as suddenly the crack stops. After a beat, there is a chilling sucking sound. John, his heart pounding from his temples to his toes, op the refrigerator. Inside he sees the eyeless, tongueless, sawed-open head o Roman Links.  The white tape still covers his broken nose A scream catches like a barb in John's throat. The knife slips from his hand, clattering to the floor. hand covers his mouth as he stumbles back, slamming into lockers. Otto, still sucking the marrow from the femur bone whirls the crash and sees John.  He lets out a shrill animal yel as -- John runs. Otto grabs the nearest cleaver and flails after him. John slams through the rows of lockers, around a corner towards the stairs now in sight but, Otto whips around th corner gaining -- Raising the cleaver as John stumbles on the first steps, lunges up the curving stairs just as Otto swings -- The cleaver just misses, embedding into the wooden tread. Jerking it free, Otto scales the stairs into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But John is already gone, the back door thrown open.  Ott about to follow when a hand reaches out and stops him.  O hunches back like a heeled dog as Rex steps toward the do He closes it and, in his black eyes, we see the hint of a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment door signal is buzzing.  And buzzing. The light goes on and Ophelia enters, obviously annoyed, hitting the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is you, Roman -- you fucking asshole -- the police are on the way -- She switches to "listen."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.  Ophelia -- it's John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, it's three-thirty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Ophelia, something happended -- something bad -- She presses the "enter" button.  As soon as she unlocks t door.  John bursts in.  He is shaking and out of breath. hair, despite the cold, is slick with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John -- what happened? Immediately, he is pacing around the small apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Roman? A little squeak jumps out of John's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Roman? John nods, hands wringing, fingers knotting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the mission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  You saw Roman in the refrigerator? John nods again, unable to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see.  It was another bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, it's real.  They told me what they were doing.  They told me the first day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They butcher their own meat.  It's cheaper that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, you're not making any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't know!  I swear to you I didn't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  I'm calling the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they won't... believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I didn't know because I was there, like everyone else.  Every night.  Two bowls.  They'll know it's still inside me, they'll smell it.  I can smell it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, something is wrong with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know.  It's the meat.  I can feel it.  I ate it every night, Ophelia, and it's making me sick because... His stomach convulses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tasted so... Horror and revulsion rise with human bile as he clamps hi hand over his mouth and runs to the bathroom. Forcing herself to remain calm, Ophelia follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is kneeling on the floor, half-dead, his head still hanging over the toilet. She kneels beside him, taking hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be okay.  Maybe its some kind of food poisoning.  Making you half crazy. Shivering and weak, he wraps his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need rest.  You need sleep. As she hold him, his breathing begins to ease.  She softl kisses his head resting on her shoulder. He turns his head, kissing her neck when something happen him.  She feels his body go rigid with fear. There is the soft curve of her neck, he smells something, something just beneath her skin, something that tastes... good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John? He screams, scrambling away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!  What!! He's too terrified to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, John, you're scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's happening to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! She jumps to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of this shit! She throws open the medicine cabinet and grabs a large bo of sleeping pills.  She filles a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to calm down.  You need to sleep.  When you wake up, we'll talk. She shoves the glass into his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open! He opens his mouth and she drops in several capsules.  He drinks and swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is still dark, the venetian blinds holding back morning. John, his face as gray as ash, is asleep on the futon, wrapped tightly in a mess of sheets.  It was a torturous night. A smell fills his nostrils, a terrible gagging smell and coughs, waking up. Rex Mundi, fully dressed, is sitting in the room, deep in shadow.  A single slice of light cuts across his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, citizen. John scrambles back into the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you?  Where's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fair Ophelia stepped out to find you something to eat. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it won't be enough, will it, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you are doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do.  You've known all along, from the very first bowl, that first mouthful --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your body knew at once what it had inside of it.  It was what it had always wanted. John can feel his stomach, a great gaping hole, as empty it has ever been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is what everyone wants. John grimaces.  His stomach feels like the skin of a saus grilling, about to rupture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your body has been set free. Mundi watches John in obvious anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only one true desire, John.  Everything else is a lie, a lie that begins for most when they are pulled from their mother's teat and given a bottle of cow's milk. John tries to stand, to move away.  He does not want to h this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mind learns to accept what it cannot have, but deep inside, the body never forgets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can eat until you are sick without ever feeling sated or satisfied -- why?  You will gorge yourself on the flesh of every animal except one -- why John?  Because you are afraid.  Afraid of what you really are.  Afraid that what you are is all that you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reminded you.  I woke the truth inside you.  Now, the appetite is alive. John, dripping with sweat, sinks to the floor, clutching stomach in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no god that can help you.  The appetite is a part of you now, gnawing away.  You can feel your stomach trying to digest itself. Mundi pulls a heavy package, wrapped in butcher-brown pap from his pocket.  John stares at it and we can almost see begin to drool. Mundi throws it on the floor between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can make it stop.  Give it what it wants.  Feed it. John hesitates, his glance shifting from Mundi to the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feed me. On hands and knees, John lunges for the package, tearing open.  Bloody cubes of raw meat spill out.  John stuffs t in his mouth, gobbling them down. Mundi smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy.  Good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a bitter cold night, outside a dull, gray, office building. After a long beat, we hear a woman giggling. As the giggling grows louder, we see a man and woman push out through the revolving door of the building.  He is pushing with both hands on her ass. They stagger out, obviously drunk, laughing as she stumbl in her high-heels.  Their laughter is swallowed by the emptiness of the city. The woman is disheveled; her blouse not fully buttoned, h hair tousled, her lipstick smeared.  Her appearance sugge they just had sex, yet he looks exactly as he probably lo early this morning when he entered the building.  Even hi tie is fixed tight to his collar. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out his wedding ring slides it on. The woman's laugh dies ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.  There it is. He looks at her indifferently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could wait five more fucking minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't bother you when you see me take it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're a pig.  I don't know why I fuck you. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to keep your job. Stunned and sickened by him, she rips a ruby earring from each ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me sick!  I don't want any part of you anymore! She throws the earrings at him, spins on her heel and wal away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow. He smiles, picks up the earrings and slips them into his pocket. Whistling, he heads towards the entrance of an undergroun parking garage.  Its staircase darkens into a black shado that swallows the man as he descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man appears, rounding the corner of the first level.  Abruptly, he stops, noticing a figure huddled in the corn of the landing below. It is John dressed in garbage-picked clothes.  The man lo away and continues down the stairs toward John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister?  Mister? The man does not acknowledge him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, can you help me? John reaches out with his hand as the man passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry -- John grabs hold of the man's pant leg.  The man is repuls and jerks his leg free.  His footsteps quickly fade down stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry... John crawls to the edge of the landing, listening as the to the level below opens and closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vast garage is ominously empty and silent, save for t man's hurried footsteps.  From behind, the door again ope and booms shut. The man stops and looks back at the circle of light aroun the door.  It is empty. There is faint rattling in the distance. To his left, he hears the sound of someone running and he turns, catching a glimpse of a shadow that disappears beh a steel column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is someone there? Another series of running steps; a flash somewhere else. The metal rattling grows louder, closer.  The man's eyes darting.  He seems frozen, like a deer. He bolts. In the dark edges of the garage, behind the rows of colum he can see them; shadows, running with him. It is a wild chase weaving through the iron and concrete columns that seem like the trees of a man-made jungle. The man can see his red Jaguar; the silver cat is poised the hood as the man races towards it.  Behind him the predators gain. He tears out his keys and jams the key into the lock when There is an animal shriek. John bounds up, springing over the car, landing on top of terrified, screaming man. They tumble to the ground, John rolling away. The man, free for a moment, tries to get back to the car, scampering on hands and knees. He reaches for the handle, for the keys, but the keys are gone. He hears the jingling keys behind him.  He begins to cry, turning to see -- The predators surrounding him; John, Otto, and Kuru, dang the keys. The jingle of the keys blends into the metal rattle as Gr moves into the half circle, pushing her grocery shopping cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? He throws his wallet at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here -- take it!  Take it!  Please don't hurt me. They close in on him, Kuru and Otto taking hold of his ar as the man, feeble, unable to resist, continues to sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssh, now.  This'll just take a minute. She pets his head, trying to calm him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, nothing to worry about. She runs her fingers across his forehead, coating them wi his sweat.  She licks them, tasting, smacking her lips an tongue.  Not bad. Inspecting closer, she reaches under his arm, pinching hi fat.  He is now crying uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, John. From her shopping cart, Granny pulls a baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a keeper. She gives John the bat and pushes him up to the plate. The man on his knees, his arms still held behind him, loo up at John pitifully. John stands motionless. The man begins repeating the word "god" over and over. John raises the bat.  The man drops his head as he fills pants with urine.  John's grip loosens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... Granny stands behind him, whispering in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can and you will.  Because deep down you want to. John shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him, John.  See him for what he really is.  Meat.  That's all.  Fresh marbled meat that you can smell.  Meat you can almost taste. John's mouth begins to salivate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only one truth in this world, one law to obey, one rule to survive.  Eat, John.  Eat or be eaten. His face contorts viciously as he raises the bat. The scream fills the entire garage. The bat falls. There is a loud pop as the bat strikes the back of the ma skull. The scream fades, but never seems to die; just a dim echo roar in our ears.  Granny pats John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of us now. Kuru and Otto lift the body of the man and load it into t shopping cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia walks down the hall towards the glass door of the clinic.  She digs the keys from her purse and stoops to unlock the doors when she notices a manila envelope with name on it. Inside the envelope is a note from John: "I'm sorry that haven't been myself lately.  I hope these will help you forgive me." She tilts the envelope and a pair of ruby earrings spill her palm.  They are the same earrings the woman threw bac the man. Ophelia smiles and unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia is admiring her new earrings in the mirror behind desk when Shelley enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Ophelia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Ms. Perdue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are your thighs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much better today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so proud of you, Ophelia.  It was a big step, wasn't it? Ophelia nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, the first step is always the hardest but now a whole new world of possibilities has opened up for you, you can feel it, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I suppose I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're still so young and pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now maybe we'll finally get to fix that little nose of yours. She winks teasingly and passes Ophelia but stops at the d to her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, cancel Ms. Sedier's appointment today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Was there another problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I've taken care of it.  I don't think she'll be back. Smiling, she shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretched limply over a hanger, suspended in the dark spa above us, is a beautiful dark fur. In the background we can hear John and Otto, though their voices are muffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one basic rule of thumb.  The richer they are, the more they eat, the better they taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why Rex wanted this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I think this one was a favor. We pass under the dark emptiness of the fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See here, on the flank and all along the butt and thighs.  Lipotracts.  All the tasty bits, sucked dry.  But she ain't bad. Ahead, we see the voices are coming from the shower room, which is hidden by the heavy plastic shower curtain.  The is a gap at the bottom, where we can see into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now grab one of them bottles. We can see John's shoes and the heavy rubber boots that O wears.  On the floor beside them is a funnel and several green wine jugs.  The jugs are empty. John bends down and lifts one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it like this.  Here. We hear the quick zink, zink, of a knife being sharpened. We see the three figures in the room, more defined throug the foggy plastic. The two darker figures are Otto and John, which can be determined by their feet. The other figure appears to be suspended in the air and through the translucent haze of the curtain, it looks lik great side of beef; white and pink, the colors of suet an meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just pull back on the hair and cut. Blood suddenly sprinkles onto the floor around their feet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottle!  The bottle! The blood stops, as we hear it filling the bottle.  Otto slaps the naked flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one here'll probably fill three and a half or so.  After they're drained, I'll show you what's next.  It's easier than you think. Zink, zink, the knife sharpens again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here at the tailbone, about an inch deep, right down the spine. There is a strange zipping sound. John steps back as though he suddenly lost his balance.  Blood is missing the bottle and splattering around his fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, here... and here. We are almost to the curtain and the blood is everywhere, puddling on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you just cut a finger hole... and tear. An awful tearing noise begins as -- The bottle that John had been filling, slips out of his h shattering on the tile floor, in a deafening explosion of green glass and blood. John turns towards the curtain, lunging out, gulping air. The heavy rubber boots step through the pool of blood, gl crunching underfoot, past the swinging shadow of the hang body. Otto throws open the curtain and finds John sitting on th bench between the lockers, breathing deep and looking ver sick. Otto shakes his head, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granny's probably got some work for you upstairs. John looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can throw all that stuff in the furnace.  But not the coat.  It's a good coat. Otto snaps the curtain shut and again we hear the knife sharpening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bowl is being washed.  John passes it under the running water, rinses it, then sets it in the rack. John stares blankly as he lifts another dirty bowl from t cart. The crusty, brown remnants of the stew, thin scrape lines left from the spoon. John begins to hear the scraping of the spoon against the bowl.  He is unable to move, listening. We hear the man eating, slurping the stew, smacking on th thick pieces of meat. John looks at the enormous stack of dirty bowls piled on cart.  The number has grown to almost comic proportions. begin to hear more eating noises. The munching, scraping, clattering spoons multiply, growi louder, swelling, until it seems the entire dining hall w stuffed into the tiny kitchen. Suddenly, there is a knock on the back door, cutting the noise short. John shuts the water off goes to the door.  He throws the bolt and opens the door to find Ophelia. She pulls back her hair, revealing the ruby earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love them. She embraces and kisses John who reacts awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... thought you were feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  I just, I mean, I wish... He glances at the open basement door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't come here anymore, Ophelia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? He doesn't want to answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Let's go upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, what's going on?  You have to tell me.  I want to know why you were acting so strange the other night and why you disappeared that morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He can't stop himself from smiling at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so beautiful. She blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are your legs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see? He sits on the bed beside her and tries to push her skirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I can't remove the bandages yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a peek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, John.  Stop.  Come on, talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened the other night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I'm not sure I can explain it.  And even if I could, I don't think you could understand it.  Not yet, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just had this feeling lately that there's this connection between us, like we're headed in the same direction and that, right now, you're learning the same things that I'm learning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Learning what things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things like who and what you are.  And more importantly, what you want. He leans into her and kisses her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You liked the earrings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Very much.  But I have to know where you got the money for them.  And don't tell me Granny gave it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were donated to the Mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older woman, or, I mean, her estate.  She died and gave everything to Rex.  He said I could pick out what I wanted.  I took the earrings and... He crosses to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to save it and give it to you later, for your birthday maybe or Christmas but I think you should have it now. From the closet, he pulls the long, lush fur coat.  Ophel clamps her hand over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. John offers it to her though she seems almost scared to t it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. Her fingers disappear beneath the thick, soft fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it on. She smiles guiltily, but turns and lets him slip it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god, John.  I can't believe this.  There's woman who comes to the clinic who has a coat like this.  I've always wondered what it would feel like to wear one. She models herself in the mirror, wrapped in its luxuriousness. John, behind her, is excited by the animal skins.  He bur his head in her hair which tumbles loose in the fur.  He feels the fur against his naked arms wrapped around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. He kisses her neck and ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fur.  It's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it felt good. She smiles, almost intoxicated by the feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to what your body wants. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like Rex. He unbuttons her blouse, exposing her naked body beneath black coat.  His hand strokes across the fur finding her breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, please, we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no one needs to talk. She moans, closing her eyes. She moans again.  And he answers in a low, almost bestial growl.  He begins to bite at her hair, her shoulder and u along her neck.  The more he touches her, her warm flesh under the animal skin, the more excited they become. He presses her against the wall, his hands moving through fur, down her wallet, where he begins to pull the coat an her skirt up along the back of her thighs. Against the wall, in the shadows of the room, lost in the coat, she looks very much like an animal standing on its legs. He begins to nibble at her ear lobe.  Licking it, pulling it with his lips and as he sucks it we hear her earrings tinking against his teeth. Suddenly, her expression changes.  Blood begins to seep f his tightly pursed lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John -- ow! He holds her tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, that hurts! She screams and as she tears free, we hear his teeth biti through the cartilage. John stumbles back, his mouth and chin covered with blood She covers her bleeding ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Ophelia throws off the coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?! John, stunned, still has something in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Shaking her head, she rushes out the door. John is unable to say anything, unable to understand what has become. After a moment, he tastes the piece of her earlobe and earring in his mouth.  He spits it into his hand, blood a saliva running between his fingers.  He closes his hand i a fist, holding it tightly. John turns to the window and watches Ophelia burst into t alley, running from the building. He is seen pressed against the panes of the window, like animal pressed against the bars of its cage. Granny opens the door to John's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John. John cannot move.  Ophelia is gone. Granny gently turns John from the window.  She begins to clean the blood from his face with a dish towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsk.  Had a little mess, here, didn't we? He stands numbly, his fist still clenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard at first.  It'll get better. John, suddenly, looks straight at Granny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bit her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, honey.  I know.  It's okay.  It's natural. She continues to clean him, dabbing the towel to her tong and then wiping his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know that cats eat their young?  Rex kept telling me that, over and over. She pauses for a moment, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt so bad about it, for a long time, but Rex just kept saying, "It's natural, Gretchen.  It's natural."  That's when I wondered.  Something has to die for something else to keep on living. She puts the towel to his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, blow. John blows his nose into the towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you just need to get some sleep. She leads him to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep makes everything feel better. He lays down.  She sees the blood leaking from his fist a tries to open it.  He jerks it away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I know.  One day you'll understand.  You'll see. He clutches his fist to his chest and rolls away from her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is much later that night. John is having a nightmare, tossing in his sleep, his fac beaded with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything moves very slowly as John rises up to see hims standing with the baseball bat.  He sees everything from perspective of the man he killed. The bat smashes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's head whips sideways as if he had been bashed by th bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is hanging upside down, staring at the tile floor an the feet of Otto and John, as Otto slits his throat. We watch as John holds the bottle, catching the stream of blood.  The bottle slips and we see it slowly fall and smash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John bolts upright, his mouth gaping, as though he were trying to scream, but couldn't. He grabs his throat to make sure it isn't slit. He calms down, his breathing begins to slow. He looks at his hand, which is still knotted into a tight fist.  Slowly, the hand opens, but to his horror, it is empty.  The earring is gone. He jumps out of bed and runs to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clicking on the white light, John goes to the sink and tu on the cold water. He gulps at the stream for a long time before coming up f air. He lifts his head and catches his reflection in the mirro He sees he has begun to sweat tiny beads of blood.  He tr to wipe it off but he cannot. He begins to cough.  He doubles over, his face turning br red, unable to breathe, unable to dislodge the object cau in his throat. He gags, a spray of blood dotting the sink, and hacks something out onto the porcelain. It is an entire ear with the earring. He starts to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, again, covered in sweat, bolts upright from his dre There is blood on his lips. He looks at his fist and opens it.  The earring is gone. He starts to cry, collapsing into himself, curling up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god.  What's happened to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is late, near the end of the day.  The phone rings and Ophelia answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slimage Surgicenter, how can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Detective Darrow with the Chicago P.D.  I need to speak with one Shelley M. Perdue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.  One moment. She puts the detective on hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Perdue, there is a police detective that would like to speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  How strange.  Put him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, detective. Ophelia is about to disconnect but stops herself and stay the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Perdue, I'm sorry to bother you but I'm investigating a missing persons and I need to ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you verify that Ms. Evelyn Sedier was a patient of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she was.  For several years, we've been seeing Evelyn for a variety of procedures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Ms. Sedier have an appointment scheduled on the afternoon of the 12th?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she did.  But the appointment was canceled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell me why? Ophelia fiddles nervously with her bandaged ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There had been a problem with Evelyn's payments for the past several appointments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She owed the clinic money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty six thousand dollars, I believe was the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see, one last question, Ms. Perdue.  Do you have any idea what might have happened to Ms. Sedier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I don't know, detective, but why don't you ask my secretary? Ophelia looks back at the mirror, feeling the presence of Shelley behind the silvered glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has been listening to our conversation.  I suspect she can tell you what happened to poor Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't know anything. The phone line goes dead.  Ophelia twists back to find Re Mundi, his hand still over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex?  What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the answer to that question, Ophelia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  I swear I don't. Mundi moves around the desk as Ophelia backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do.  You tried the coat on, didn't you?  You knew the truth the moment you tried it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's a lie! He steps closer and Ophelia pulls the dinner knife from h pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.  I love a little vinegar in my greens. He grabs for her and she swipes wildly, ducking past him bolting into the hall while -- Shelley appears behind her and grabs her by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Rex, she's mine.  You got the boy.  I get the girl. Ophelia screams, fighting for the knife which she twists and -- Slashes across Shelley's breast, causing clear saline to from the lacerated implant. From behind, Mundi grabs Ophelia, lifting her into the ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little bitch!  You're going to pay for that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mundi slams Ophelia down onto the operating table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No!  Please! He holds her down as Shelley holds her in place with a he roll of white medical tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you look deep enough, you know the answer, Ophelia.  Isn't this all your fault?  Didn't you bring John to the Mission in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?! Mundi laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to tell you that I am a demon, an incubi as old as hunger itself or that Shelley was born beneath the face of the first mirror?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex, never reveal a woman's age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you would prefer a more secular answer.  That we are manifestations of human nature created by your subconscious to anthropomorphize your darkest fears, your guilt and desire. He moves in closer, savoring her helplessness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conclusion is really the same, isn't it, my dear? He is close enough to whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nature is evil. He smiles, showing her the long hollow needle-tube of the liposuction machine.  Ophelia begins to scream when Shell stuffs her mouth with gauze and secures it with more tape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck it all out, Rex dear.  Suck her dry.  I want every last lovely drop. The machine whirs to life, and Mundi begins inspecting th meaty part of each thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, pretty girl.  It'll be over soon.  It's just another bad dream. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it? Ophelia screams into her gag as Mundi inserts the needle begins to suck the life out of her until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wakes, shaking with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god... John... The words seems to conjure a resolve and she suddenly kno what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia creeps down the back alley, looking for a way int the mission.  She finds the basement window that Links br open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia crawls down into the putrid lavatory.  The smell the basement assaults her.  Quietly, she moves through th greasy rot of the showers and enters the locker labyrinth She hears someone descending the stairs.  Trying to keep herself calm, she hides inside one of the lockers. Kuru turns the corner just as she closes the door.  Carry several empty wine jugs, he walks past the locker where s is hiding. Through the metal slits she sees him.  Suddenly, like a d catching a scent, he stops.  His nostrils flare. Blood pounds against her temples as her body sets, rigid fear.  He seems about to look straight at her when he tur and continues on his way. With painstaking care, she opens the locker, then hurries silently as she can to the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coldly quiet, the kitchen appears to be empty.  Ophelia rushes to the back staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again wrestling with his dreams, John lays in a tangle of sheets.  Ophelia sits softly beside him, touching him gen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John. He jerks awake as though electrified by her touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia? He looks around, expecting another dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It's me.  I'm here. She touches his face and the warmth of her hand fills him with emotion.  He wraps his arms around her, drawing her tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia... I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not your fault.  I brought you here. She takes hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, look at me.  The police were at the clinic today, asking me all sorts of questions about Shelley and Ms. Sedier.  Then they started asking about Rex and the mission. He pulls away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  What's happening here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't ask me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.  It's too late for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I don't believe that.  Come on, we're getting out of here. She grabs his clothes from the floor and begins dressing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Ophelia, leave this place and just forget about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.  I won't.  Don't you get it?  I love you. He feels those words, trying to heal some part of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then come with me. He nods, when suddenly he sees something over her shoulde that frightens him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? She turns and finds Mundi standing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia, you are, as always, a feast for the eyes. Kuru stands at the door, a bloody baseball bat cradled in arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex?  Good.  I was hoping to see you.  I wanted to thank you and to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I believe you will be saying goodbye but you won't be leaving here, will she John? John can almost feel Mundi squeezing his intestines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke with Shelley, Ophelia.  She told me you were talking to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell them anything!  I don't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Ophelia, still living in denial.  Like so many others, unable to face what a part of them has always known to be true.  There is only one truth that is universal, that is eternal and everlasting. His eyes gleam with the wet-black of coal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunger. Ophelia feels the knife in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is hunger that drives us, hunger for power, for love, for money, for beauty.  It is hunger that shapes us, that gives our lives purpose, and in the end, it is hunger that separates the world into the only two distinctions that matter: that of predator and that of prey. He steps towards her with malice in his grin and she rips knife from her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I do enjoy a little vinegar with my greens. Ophelia feels a strange dyslexic blur of dreams and reali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Ophelia?  You look as if you've seen a ghost. He grabs the knife hand, twisting it behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  John, help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, John.  Help her. Kuru hands John the bat.  He turns to Ophelia, his eyes c and dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John!  John!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia, you shouldn't have come here. His grip tightens on the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, fight him.  It's not too late, you have to believe me.  John?  Please, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  The magic elixir of love.  But what is love, really?  Sadly, it is little more than something we simply acquire a taste for, like sex, or power, or chocolate.  I myself must confess to a certain weakness for vegetarians. He holds her face as if he might kiss her, staring at her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such beautiful canines wasted... Ophelia rips free of his grip and bites down, sinking her teeth into his hand.  Mundi howls with rage as -- John's face contorts as a bestial cry rises out of him an raises the bat -- Smashing it down, cracking it against Mundi's head. Ophelia tears free and Mundi falls while john attackes Ku forcing him back into the bathroom until -- He grabs Ophelia and they bolt from the room. Kuru helps Mundi, blood oozing down his temple as he quic regains consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto rises up the stairs, a cleaver in each hand as Ophel and John turn, scrambling back up the stairs. At the end of the hall, Kuru now rushes towards them as t flee, running wildly through the first open door -- Slamming it and bolting it just as Kuru batters against i

dialogues.text: What are we going to do? Caged windows glow with moonlight.  It seems that they ar trapped.  John examines them even as Kuru and Otto contin to bludgeon on the door. There is a small padlock and latch which is screwed into window jamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need... He takes the dinner knife from her.  The screws turn, painfully slow, as the door shrieks with every shouldered blow. Finally, the cage opens.  They are over two stories above alley.  To the left, several windows away is an open wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way. The bolt begins to splinter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first. Ophelia summons her courage and crawls out onto the stone ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right behind you. Forcing herself to stare at the open window, she edges to it.  John looks back once, the door suddenly quiet, then climbs out onto the ledge. Together they slide, inch by inch, along the thin stone e

dialogues.text: Careful. Ophelia slowly reaches for the sash, bending down, she cr into the dark opening.  There is a muffled bump, as if sh fell to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia? He edges closer, unable to see inside the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia? He is about to climb in when Otto jumps out at him.  John shouts, twisting away but loses his balance -- His arms flail wildly, trying to find some kind of hold a begins to fall -- He dives forward, grabbing hold of the window ledge.  Leg kicking helplessly, he dangles over the alley, holding on the ledge with one hand. Mundi steps out of the shadows, looking down at John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here.  Don't worry.  She'll be joining you soon enough. Mundi smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came here with only one thing to offer me.  Your hands.  That's why I couldn't let you leave, John.  We had a deal. He nods to Otto and John suddenly sees the horror of what about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo! There is the flash of a sharpened wedge of steel as the cleaver -- Buries itself into the wood sill, just behind the bone of wrist and -- John screams, plummeting to the alley below where he slam into a pile of over-ripe bags of garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are unsure of where we are.  Dirty white lines of mold grout stretch out like lines of longitude of a dark, unre world. We begin to move, dragged roughly, our blurry single eye sliding along the greasy green ceramic tile. Our vision fades in and out as the world begins to tilt w a racheting chain ringing in our ears until the hard gree squares slowly fall away and spin lightly beneath us. We are dangling there when we see the bloody stump at the of one arm as we realize that we are John, naked, hanging upside down in the shower room. Again, we black out.

dialogues.text: In a minute.  I just want a little sip of him while it's still nice and warm.

dialogues.text: Half conscious, John begins to hear a familiar sound; zin zink.  He tries to reach up to free his feet but he has n hand.

dialogues.text: She's on ice, John-boy.  After dinner's served tonight, Rex promised us a little treat, sashimi. Otto grabs his hair, pulling him back, exposing his throa

dialogues.text: John sees his pile of clothes nearby.  They seem to be ou reach but he begins to swing toward them, each time drawi closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuru finds the chain curled around the base of the refrigerator and the inverted, limp handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto!  Otto! Otto turns just as Ophelia plunges a long boning knife in Otto's hump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bitch! He grabs for her but she knees him in the groin, shoving back against the wall where the knife hits the open fuse box -- Electrifying Otto, cooking him instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the faintest of holds, John catches the sleeve of hi coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straining to stay conscious, John searches the pockets un he finds what he needs; the dinner knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ophelia creeps silently through the maze, trying to not e breathe. Kuru follows her scent; a true predator stalking its prey She turns a corner, moving through the black space by tou her fingers using the lockers as the blind use braille. There is a sharp metal bang behind her.  She freezes, afr Crouching, she listens, almost feeling the darkness come alive around her as -- We move up to the top of the locker where Kuru stands barefoot, perched above her like a jungle cat. His knife hisses against the leather of his belt.  Opheli hears it and bolts -- Rushing blindly, searching for the showers until -- She runs straight into Kuru.  He slams her back, pinning against the lockers. The long knife traces down her body like a finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I just been dying for a piece of this ass. Hearing something, he turns to see John heave the enormou wine jug -- Smashing down onto Kuru who crumbles under the explosion, falling with a shower of blood and green glass. Ophelia and John collapse into each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granny stands at the edge of the basement stairs, calling into the stygian dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto!  Kuru!  Quit your monkey business and get up here!  Can't you hear them? Behind her, through the double doors, the clatter of spoo can be heard. Fretting, she wipes her hands on her apron and goes to th stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex?  Rex!  Dammit, where are you?  I need help. She tries to lift the enormous pot of stew but it is obviously too heavy.  The stew sloshes about precariously as some spills over the edge, splattering against the flo the clattering spoons seem to react. John, dressed now, with a towel wrapped around his hand, leads Ophelia up from the stairs.  Granny whirls around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?... John, Ophelia... Her smile is dark and toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting out and if you try to stop us, I will kill you. They cross to the metal backdoor but each and every lock been thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the keys? Granny smiles innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, John, I need help.  Can't you hear them?  It's late.  So late.  They're hungry.  They have to eat.  Everyone must eat -- He rushes at her, pinning her throat against the metal refrigerator with his forearm as he searches the pockets her apron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave, John!  No one leaves Rex!  No one! John finds the keys but when he turns to Ophelia, Granny attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! She jumps on his back, knocking him into the counter wher slams against the enormous oven. Falling, he grabs hold of the oven door which yawns open they tumble to the floor. Granny sinks her few remaining teeth into his shoulder, b bubbling out around her leathery lips as -- John, howling mad, gets hold of her and flips her over on the oven door which he quickly kicks shut -- Rolling her into the hot metal box, locking it shut as sh yowls in pain.  The oven jerks and bangs, smoke billowing until her screams die. John stumbles over to the steel door.  The room seems to quiet. There is a dream-like quantity to the number of keys and locks and a dream-like quality to the struggle to find ea match. With only one hand, John fumbles the key ring.  Smoke swi around him, sweat stings his eyes as a single sound begin rise, like blood pounding in his temples, a sound that bl out even the metal clatter of keys; the soft burble of st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, let me help you. He almost can't hear her as she takes the ring of keys. stew continues to call, siren-like, luring him towards th stove. He stands over the pot, finger-like wisps of fragrant ste steam curling around him, running through his hair. Turning away, he looks at the smoke-blurred image of Ophe trying to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry... Please... He sees himself reflected in the metal door of the refrigerator.  A fat bubble of stew pops as the distant rhythm of beating bowls grows more and more insistent. His mouth begins to water, his stomach growls and, when h glimpses the reflection again, he does not see himself, h sees Mundi. The final lock snaps open and Ophelia throws open the doo Outside, the alley seems empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John!  Come on! When she turns back to the open door, Rex Mundi is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving before a meal is bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  John! He grabs her by the neck, backing her into the kitchen, gagging her with his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, John.  Go ahead.  One last taste, one little finger dip, and then you can go. John feels Mundi taking hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you my word, John.  One last taste and I will release the lovely Ophelia and you and she may do as you wish. Ophelia tries to scream, "No" as John stands at the edge the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No more deals. John grabs the entire pot and lifts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? He pitches the pot forward, throwing half the stew onto t floor. The steaming brown liquid rushes over Mundi and Ophelia's feet, running across the tile, spilling under the double doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done? There is a huge commotion of scraping chairs and tables a hundreds of people scramble to the doors. The first few slam against them, followed quickly by a do more. John holds the pot which is half filled with stew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give that to me. John shakes his head as outside becomes a feeding frenzy, tongues and fingers lapping at the bottom of the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to live you will give that to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go! The frenzy becomes more and more violent, marked by besti cries as bodies begin pounding against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making your final mistake, John!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember this, John.  Wherever you go, I'll be there with you.  Remember that.  You are what you eat. He shoves Ophelia towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it! He throws the remaining stew at Mundi, covering him from to toe in thick, brown gravy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. The double doors burst open with a savage force as -- John and Ophelia jump into the alley, slamming the door s bracing against it as the tidal wave of humanity slams Mu against the metal. Blood pours out of the bottom of the door, an unnatural amount of blood, a waterfall of red, rushing down the concrete steps and washing over their feet. The pounding against the door becomes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pounding of a single palm against a bottle of ketchup The bottle coughs and the thick red sauce gushes onto a hamburger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm starving. As the man sinks his teeth into his hamburger, we see Joh and Ophelia enter the diner. It has been several days.  Both are bandaged, John's hand thoroughly wrapped, and are carrying their suitcases. The fat cook watches as Ophelia reaches into her pocket. slaps the dinner knife onto the counter.  It is bent and flecked with blood. Arm in arm, they turn and leave.
